vulnerabilities.title: Ssrf in SecureApp Inc
vulnerabilities.description: Discovered Server-Side Request Forgery via URL params affecting SecureApp Inc. The application does not properly sanitize user input, allowing an attacker to inject malicious payloads that are executed by the application.
vulnerabilities.impact: An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to make requests to internal systems and potentially access sensitive data.
reproduction_steps: Observe that the payload is executed
vulnerabilities.proof_of_concept:
# Proof of Concept

Payload: http://localhost

This demonstrates Server-Side Request Forgery via URL params

# Validation at 2025-11-11T01:55:37.738677
Validation successful with alternative payload at 2025-11-11T01:55:37.738675
vulnerabilities.remediation: Validate and sanitize all URLs. Implement allowlist of permitted domains. Use network segmentation to limit internal access.

vulnerabilities.title: Path Traversal in SecureApp Inc
vulnerabilities.description: Discovered Path traversal in file operations affecting SecureApp Inc. The application does not properly sanitize user input, allowing an attacker to inject malicious payloads that are executed by the application.
vulnerabilities.impact: An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to read arbitrary files on the server filesystem.
reproduction_steps: Observe that the payload is executed
vulnerabilities.proof_of_concept:
# Proof of Concept

Payload: ../../../etc/passwd

This demonstrates Path traversal in file operations

# Validation at 2025-11-11T01:55:37.738682
Validation successful with alternative payload at 2025-11-11T01:55:37.738680
vulnerabilities.remediation: Validate file paths against allowlist. Use secure APIs that prevent directory traversal. Implement proper access controls on filesystem operations.
